results.title: Chocolat [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, David Brown Productions, David Brown, Kit Golden, Leslie Holleran and Lasse Hallstrom
results.brief_description: Set in rural France, 1959, “Chocolat” is a comic look at traditional mores of a community dominated by the presence of the Catholic Church, revolutionised by the presence of a free-spirited woman with radical ideas about freedom of choice and sensuality. Vianne and her young daughter arrive in Lansquenet, a town where people live austerely, and miserably, whilst disguising their many sins and foibles. Vianne opens a chocolatiers in the main square, just prior to Lent, which causes a scandal among the locals, who slander Vianne, despite being intrigued by her delicious concoctions. But more than just tasty morsels, Vianne’s food is tonic for woes whether it is ennui, grumpiness or impotence. The drama of the Mayor’s intentions to run Vianne out of town is complicated by the presence of Roux (Johnny Depp) a gypsy who is shunned, (along with his brood), by the townsfolk and forms a romantic attachment with Vianne. The film, peppered with stars, is quite saccharine in tone and, at times, cloying with its good intentions. But despite these quibbles, “Chocolat” is distinctly and effectively feel-good and is glorious to look at even as it mythologises an unrecognisable France of the 1950s. Hallstrom (Cider house rules, My life as a dog, The Shipping news) produces his most digestible, albeit unchallenging work to date.

results.title: Chocky
results.creator_credit: Thorn EMI, Vic Hughes and Christopher Hodson
results.brief_description: Matthew Gore’s life is just like any other 12 year olds, until he meets ‘Chocky’. What makes Chocky different from Matthew’s other friends is that she cannot be seen, speaks inside Matthew’s head and is an explorer from another world. Matthew develops new physical and mental capabilities through Chocky’s guidance, however it also isolates him from family and friends and eventually throws him into the media spotlight. Matthew is forced to make some adult decisions about his unique friend and their relationship. Based on the novel by renowned science fiction writer John Wyndham.

results.title: Chip Carving
results.brief_description: Chip carving is a wonderfully direct and simple way to decorate furniture, cabinets, boxes and plaques. Discusses the basics: how to approach design, sharpen the knife, hold a consistent angle and use it to carve four different borders, a rosette and a free form.

results.title: Chiostri e cortili
results.creator_credit: Istuto Nazionale Luce and Ubaldo Magnachi
results.brief_description: An exploration of the architectural beauty and historical associations of cloisters and courtyards in and around Rome. Includes views of San Giovanni in Lateran, Santa Maria del Angeli and some of the work of Michelangelo. Commentary is in Italian.
results.description: An exploration of the architectural beauty and historical associations of cloisters and courtyards in and around Rome. Includes views of San Giovanni in Lateran, Santa Maria del Angeli and some of the work of Michelangelo. Commentary is in Italian.

results.title: Chinese take away [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Looking Glass Pictures, SBS Independent and Mitzi Goldman
results.brief_description: Written and performed by Anna Yen, and adapted for television from the original stage play, “Chinese take away” tells the story about Anna’s grandmother, her mother and herself through a unique and unusual blend of poetic storytelling, re-enactments, stills and archival footage, and artistically evocative images of movement and surrealism. Through her interpretive stories, Anna plays out the characters of her grandmother, mother and her father to seek out the truth in the hope of understanding her family on a more intimate and personal level - to put herself in their shoes. This journey of discovery spans several decades from early 1900s China and 1930s Hong Kong, through to 1960s suburban Sydney and into the present day. But it is the story of her mother that is particularly moving and Anna’s captivating portrayal as she reveals her mother’s inner thoughts and emotions and the tragic circumstances that became her life. This is compelling viewing, with powerful and mesmerising visuals, a haunting soundtrack, and human stories of personal history and cultural heritage, themes often used by award-winning director, Mitzi Goldman (Hatred, Snakes and ladders, Things I call mine). Cast also includes Natasha Chiew (young Anna), Natalie Tjen (teenage Anna), Eve Wang (young mother), Maggie Chung (young grandmother). Cinematography by Himman Dhamija.

results.title: Chinese shadow play
results.creator_credit: China Film Enterprises of America and Wan-go Wen
results.brief_description: The shadow-play is one of the most popular Chinese folk-arts; it appeared in China during the 10th century A.D. this film presents a shortened version of the traditional tale of the White Snake Lady, one of the most popular of all Chinese fairy tales. The figures are made from translucent parchment, (in China, from donkey skin) which is painted in delicate colors, and to which wires for manipulation are attached. The drama is performed by manipulating the figures behind an illuminated screen, to the accompaniment of Chinese drums, gongs, and cymbals; the melodramatic dialogue is spoken from behind the screen by the manipulators. Animation and demonstration by Pauline Benton. Narrated by Arvo Wirta.

results.title: Chinese roulette = Chinesisches roulette
results.creator_credit: Albatros, Les Films du Losange and Rainer Werner Fassbinder
results.brief_description: An intense, psychological comedy/drama about a disabled girl, Angela (Andrea Schober), who plots to get herself, both her parents (Alexander Allerson and Margit Cristensen), and their respective lovers (Anna Karina and Ulli Lommel) to the family’s country house all at the same time. The scene is set for a weekend of intense embarassments and confrontations, climaxing in the game of psychological warfare, Chinese Roulette. Typically Fassbinder, the film is a biting attack on the institution of marriage and on middle-class morality. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Chinese legends, gods and prophets
results.creator_credit: Mass Communications and Sumner J. Glimcher
results.brief_description: An introduction to oriental myth, religion and philosophy from the Shang Dynasty, 1766-l122 BC, to rites connected with ancestor worship as practised today in Taiwan.

results.title: China: times of jade and bronze (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Michael Gill
results.brief_description: In 1973 an exhibition of Chinese art was presented at the Royal Academy in London. Many of the prize pieces appear in this film, which evolves into an extensive journey through modern China to visit many of the sites from which the treasures came, putting them into the context of place and history. With William Watson and Magnus Magnusson. Museum sequences directed by Ray Sutcliffe, photographed by Phil Meheux.
